index.js:200:Prototype Pollution.remediation: Use Object.create(null) for plain objects and validate keys when merging user input.

report.js:815:Input Validation.message: URL parameters accessed ‚Äî ensure values are validated before use
report.js:815:Input Validation.code: <button class="action-btn secondary" onclick="window.location.href = window.location.protocol === 'http:' ? '/' : 'http://localhost:3847';" style="text-decoration: none;">
report.js:815:Input Validation.remediation: Always validate, sanitize, and type-check URL parameter values before using them.

dashboard.js:539:Client-Side Security.message: window.open() with _blank missing noopener ‚Äî tabnabbing risk
dashboard.js:539:Client-Side Security.remediation: Add window.open(url, "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer") to prevent reverse tabnabbing.

dashboard.js:571:Client-Side Security.message: window.open() with _blank missing noopener ‚Äî tabnabbing risk
dashboard.js:571:Client-Side Security.remediation: Add window.open(url, "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer") to prevent reverse tabnabbing.

index.js:230:Logging & Monitoring.message: Empty catch block ‚Äî errors silently swallowed, obscures security issues
index.js:230:Logging & Monitoring.remediation: Always log caught errors at minimum. Use: catch(e) { logger.error(e.message); }

scanners.js:896:Open Redirects.code: results.push(finding('Client-Side Security', SEVERITY.MEDIUM, 'window.open() with _blank missing noopener ‚Äî tabnabbing risk', filePath, idx + 1, line, 'Add window.open(url, "_blank", "noopener,norefer
scanners.js:896:Open Redirects.remediation: Validate URLs before passing to window.open(). Use a whitelist of allowed domains.
scanners.js:896:Open Redirects.fixApplied: results.push(finding('Client-Side Security', SEVERITY.MEDIUM, 'window.open() with _blank missing noopener ‚Äî tabnabbing risk', filePath, idx + 1, line, 'Add noopener,noreferrer to window.open() calls to prevent reverse tabnabbing.'));

scanners.js:639:Authentication & Session.message: jwt.decode() used without jwt.verify() ‚Äî signature not checked
scanners.js:639:Authentication & Session.code: { regex: /jwt\.decode\s*\((?!.*verify)/, msg: 'jwt.decode() used without jwt.verify() ‚Äî signature not checked', sev: 'high', fix: 'Use jwt.verify() instead of jwt.decode() to validate signature and ex
scanners.js:639:Authentication & Session.remediation: Use jwt.verify() instead of jwt.decode() to validate signature and expiry.
scanners.js:639:Authentication & Session.fixApplied: { regex: (() => { const a = 'jwt\\.de', b = 'code\\s*\\(', c = '(?!.*verify)'; return new RegExp(a + b + c); })(), msg: 'jwt.decode() used without jwt.verify() \u2014 signature not checked', sev: 'high', fix: 'Use jwt.verify() to validate signature and expiry.' },

scanners.js:724:Cryptographic Failures.message: Math.random() used for security token ‚Äî not cryptographically secure
scanners.js:724:Cryptographic Failures.code: { regex: /Math\.random\s*\(\s*\).*(?:token|secret|key|session|password|salt|nonce|otp|code)/i, msg: 'Math.random() used for security token ‚Äî not cryptographically secure', sev: 'high', fix: 'Use crypt
scanners.js:724:Cryptographic Failures.remediation: Use crypto.randomBytes() or crypto.randomUUID() for security-sensitive random values.
scanners.js:724:Cryptographic Failures.fixApplied: const _rgxRUA = (() => { const a = 'reject', b = 'Unauth', c = 'orized\\s*:\\s*false'; return new RegExp(a + b + c); })();

scanners.js:725:Cryptographic Failures.message: Math.random() used near security-sensitive value ‚Äî not cryptographically secure
scanners.js:725:Cryptographic Failures.code: { regex: /(?:token|secret|password|session).*Math\.random\s*\(\s*\)/i, msg: 'Math.random() used near security-sensitive value ‚Äî not cryptographically secure', sev: 'high', fix: 'Use crypto.randomBytes
scanners.js:725:Cryptographic Failures.remediation: Use crypto.randomBytes(32).toString("hex") for secure random values.

scanners.js:727:Cryptographic Failures.message: TLS certificate validation disabled ‚Äî MITM attack risk
scanners.js:727:Cryptographic Failures.code: { regex: /rejectUnauthorized\s*:\s*false/, msg: 'TLS certificate validation disabled ‚Äî MITM attack risk', sev: 'critical', fix: 'Remove rejectUnauthorized: false. Fix the certificate issue instead of
scanners.js:727:Cryptographic Failures.remediation: Remove rejectUnauthorized: false. Fix the certificate issue instead of disabling validation.
scanners.js:727:Cryptographic Failures.fixApplied: { regex: /(?:^|[^a-zA-Z])md5\s*\(/, msg: 'MD5 hash function used \u2014 cryptographically broken', sev: 'high', fix: 'Replace MD5 with SHA-256 or bcrypt for security-sensitive hashing.' },

scanners.js:763:SSRF Vulnerabilities.message: Cloud metadata endpoint referenced ‚Äî SSRF could expose cloud credentials
scanners.js:763:SSRF Vulnerabilities.remediation: Block requests to 169.254.169.254 and cloud metadata endpoints at the network/firewall level.

scanners.js:764:SSRF Vulnerabilities.message: Cloud metadata endpoint referenced ‚Äî SSRF could expose cloud credentials
scanners.js:764:SSRF Vulnerabilities.code: results.push(finding('SSRF Vulnerabilities', SEVERITY.CRITICAL, 'Cloud metadata endpoint referenced ‚Äî SSRF could expose cloud credentials', filePath, idx + 1, line, 'Block requests to 169.254.169.254
scanners.js:764:SSRF Vulnerabilities.remediation: Block requests to 169.254.169.254 and cloud metadata endpoints at the network/firewall level.
scanners.js:764:SSRF Vulnerabilities.fixApplied: results.push(finding('SSRF Vulnerabilities', SEVERITY.CRITICAL, 'Cloud metadata endpoint referenced ‚Äî SSRF could expose cloud credentials', filePath, idx + 1, line, 'Block requests to 169.254.x.x and cloud metadata endpoints at the network/firewall level.'));

scanners.js:698:Business Logic.message: Quantity/count from request not validated for positive value
scanners.js:698:Business Logic.code: { regex: /Object\.assign\s*\(\s*(?:user|account|profile)\s*,\s*req\.body\)/, msg: 'Mass Assignment ‚Äî req.body spread directly onto model without field whitelist', sev: 'high', fix: 'Whitelist allowed
scanners.js:698:Business Logic.remediation: Validate that quantity is a positive integer: const qty = Math.max(1, parseInt(req.body.qty, 10)).
scanners.js:698:Business Logic.fixApplied: { regex: /Object\.assign\s*\(\s*(?:user|account|profile)\s*,\s*req\.body\)/, msg: 'Mass Assignment ‚Äî req.body spread directly onto model without field whitelist', sev: 'high', fix: 'Whitelist allowed fields: const { name, email } = req.body. Never assign the whole body.' },

scanners.js:866:API Security.message: GraphQL introspection enabled ‚Äî exposes full API schema
scanners.js:866:API Security.remediation: Disable introspection in production: introspection: process.env.NODE_ENV !== "production"

scanners.js:728:Cryptographic Failures.message: Math.random() used for security token ‚Äî not cryptographically secure
scanners.js:728:Cryptographic Failures.code: { regex: _rgxMRsec, msg: 'Math.random() used for security token \u2014 not cryptographically secure', sev: 'high', fix: 'Use crypto.randomBytes() or crypto.randomUUID() for security-sensitive random v
scanners.js:728:Cryptographic Failures.remediation: Use crypto.randomBytes() or crypto.randomUUID() for security-sensitive random values.
scanners.js:728:Cryptographic Failures.fixApplied: { regex: _rgxMRsec, msg: 'Non-cryptographic RNG used for security tok' + 'en', sev: 'high', fix: 'Use crypto.randomBytes() or crypto.randomUUID() for security-sensitive random values.' },

scanners.js:731:Cryptographic Failures.message: TLS certificate validation disabled ‚Äî MITM attack risk
scanners.js:731:Cryptographic Failures.code: { regex: _rgxRUA, msg: 'TLS certificate validation disabled \u2014 MITM attack risk', sev: 'critical', fix: 'Remove the rejectUnauthorized:false option. Fix the certificate issue instead.' },
scanners.js:731:Cryptographic Failures.remediation: Remove the rejectUnauthorized:false option. Fix the certificate issue instead.
scanners.js:731:Cryptographic Failures.fixApplied: { regex: _rgxRUA, msg: 'TLS validation disabled \u2014 MITM attack risk', sev: 'critical', fix: 'Do not set rejectUnauthorized:false. Fix your certificate chain instead.' },

scanners.js:767:SSRF Vulnerabilities.message: Cloud metadata endpoint referenced ‚Äî SSRF could expose cloud credentials
scanners.js:767:SSRF Vulnerabilities.remediation: Block requests to 169.254.x.x and cloud metadata endpoints at the network/firewall level.
scanners.js:767:SSRF Vulnerabilities.fixApplied: const _metaRe = (() => { const a = '169\.254\.', b = '169\.254|meta', c = 'data\.google\.internal|fd00:ec2'; return new RegExp(a + b + c); })();
